ygData.subject: Question about using seeds as SURT prefixes
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I am using Heritrix 1.12.1 and I m taking the default approach of using seeds as SURTs. Here is an example seed list: # start of seed list http://site-a.ca

Hi, I am using Heritrix 1.12.1 and I'm taking the default approach of
using=
 seeds as SURTs.

Here is an example seed list:

# start of seed list
http:=
//site-a.ca
http://site-b.ca
# ... etc ...

The above obviously will crawl =
everything on site-a.ca and site-b.ca
AND all their subdomains.

This usual=
ly works fine but for some of my seeds the lookup fails if I
don't also hav=
e the www in the seed.  So I would rather change my seed
list to this:

htt=
p://www.site-a.ca
http://www.site-b.ca

BUT this now means I will now not g=
et the subdomains like
subdomain.site-a.ca.

So to fix this I figure I need=
 to change it to this:

http://www.site-a.ca
http://www.site-b.ca
+site-a.c=
a
+site-b.ca

This is pretty long winded especially with 1000s of seeds.  I=
s there a
better solution?  Is it possible somehow to have seeds with www a=
t the
start but make it so the www is ignored when translating it to a SURT=

form (without having to change to an OnDomains decide rule) ?  

Thanks!

=
Adam
